item.title: New-TimeSpan
item.description:
I was investigating an issue with our identity provider and out of date passwords the other day. I needed to do a date comparison to find accounts with expired passwords. In the past Iâ€™d used (Get-Date).AddDays() and done an evaluation. It works, but to me the code is hard to read.

I stumbled on the New-Timespan cmdlet which creates a timespan object. Creating a timespan object and referencing the days property is so much easier to read when you look at the code.
